intro: Pilosella saussureoides, commonly known as the hairy groundsel, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in a composite head. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It is native to temperate regions of Europe and is often found in meadows and grasslands. Pilosella saussureoides is an annual or biennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils.
